instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00850: What is 820-00850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1989: What is A1989? A1989 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2018, 2019 with EMC 3124, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00850..
definitions.820-01700: What is 820-01700? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Medium Liquid Damage Not Completely Loading OSX
threads.message:
Hi Guys, good evening. I got from a customer a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> EMC 3214, board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  and it suffered medium liquid damage, in my opinion. I replaced some caps and res, some other ones I just reflux and it's turning on now. The problem is it doesn't load the OSX until the end, even from Internal or External drives. 

The major problem I have now is, the [B]<RESISTOR>R4802</RESISTOR> [/B]lost its point 2, and looks like it's a point that sends energy to a lot of other points over the board. There's a whole in its place and I don't know how to solve this.

I run Apple diagnosis and no-fault was mentioned. The battery is still working good.

Any ideas?

Thanks, Eduardo

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Medium Liquid Damage Not Completely Loading OSX
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

I cannot find <RESISTOR>R4802</RESISTOR> on the schematic...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Medium Liquid Damage Not Completely Loading OSX
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 71640, member: 682"]
First of all, welcome to the forum!

I cannot find <RESISTOR>R4802</RESISTOR> on the schematic...
[/QUOTE]
Second craziest thing : I can locate it on the Boardview but not in the schematic. First time I see something so crazy...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Medium Liquid Damage Not Completely Loading OSX
threads.message:
Oops, that's true.
I cannot find <CHIP>U4801</CHIP> too.

As I saw in boardview, <RESISTOR>R4802</RESISTOR> is part of <SIGNAL>PPBUS_HS_CPU</SIGNAL> sensor.
Not too many connections as you've mentioned.
Try starting in SMC bypass mode.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Medium Liquid Damage Not Completely Loading OSX
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 71650, member: 682"]
Oops, that's true.
I cannot find <CHIP>U4801</CHIP> too.
[/QUOTE]
Crazy man

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Medium Liquid Damage Not Completely Loading OSX
threads.message:
We cannot get all schematics and boardviews from Apple.
There are several revisions and we are lucky if get one.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Medium Liquid Damage Not Completely Loading OSX
threads.message: Every one I found is the same revision.  Please, if you find something different, let me know. I really appreciate your help

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Medium Liquid Damage Not Completely Loading OSX
threads.message:
Did you try to start in SMC bypass mode?
Just to see if loads OSX.
You can also try safe mode.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Medium Liquid Damage Not Completely Loading OSX
threads.message:
<CHIP>U4800</CHIP>/<CHIP>U4801</CHIP> circuit can be found on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> schematics. It seems like it can throttle hard the CPU/GPU if it detects a voltage drop on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> (below 7.5V I think).
<RESISTOR>R4802</RESISTOR>/<RESISTOR>R4800</RESISTOR> is just a voltage divider from <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> to <SIGNAL>PBUS_DIVIDER</SIGNAL> (pin 1 of <CHIP>U4801</CHIP>) so that should be easily repairable.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Medium Liquid Damage Not Completely Loading OSX
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 71658, member: 682"]
Did you try to start in SMC bypass mode?
Just to see if loads OSX.
You can also try safe mode.
[/QUOTE]

I've made the SMC Bypass and the computer loaded the previous User login screen. when I put the login password to proceed, the computer restarts and it's like an ever ending cycle again...
Looks like there's something messed on the T2...

Thoughts?

Thanks again

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Medium Liquid Damage Not Completely Loading OSX
threads.message:
Try DFU mode.
Be aware, Restore option will erase entire SSD.
Better to choose Revive first, if you need the data.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Medium Liquid Damage Not Completely Loading OSX
threads.message:
Hi guys... The customer didn't care about the data, so I went to restore mode on the DFU mode... It appears to complete the process. The point is that, when I boot the computer holding option to choose and external drive, I can see my USB drive and, as I click on it to proceed, at same time it goes to the Internet Recovery... It won't be a problem if, when I chose my wifi network, and goes to the password screen to enter it, the mouse starts stepping and it never finishes the connection and do not proceed... 

I tried to start from Catalina and BigSur drives I have here. 

BTW, I don't fix the issue on the <RESISTOR>R4802</RESISTOR> yet... I don't have another resistor with same specs to put there. 

Thanks guys. 

Thoughts?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Medium Liquid Damage Not Completely Loading OSX
threads.message: You must fix that problem first, as an SMC sensor can block the system.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Medium Liquid Damage Not Completely Loading OSX
threads.message:
I'm back to work on this board... I stated that the <RESISTOR>R4802</RESISTOR> lost its point 2 [B]BUT[/B] [B]it lost[/B] [B]point 1 (<SIGNAL>PPBUS_HS_CPU</SIGNAL>)[/B]. That's why I told you, it had a lot of other points on the board. I run a wire from this pin 1 to the other side of the board and the Internet recovery is now working and the computer is back to life.

Thanks for the help and you can close the thread.
